item.title: Batley and Spen: Labour is back after by-election win, says Starmer
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer hails Kim Leadbeater's victory in Batley and Spen as "just the start" for his party.

item.title: Angela Merkel hopes to open up travel for double-jabbed visitors to Germany
item.description: Quarantine may be eased for fully vaccinated visitors to Germany from the UK, Angela Merkel says.

item.title: Covid: PM confident of no problem over India jab travel
item.description: The UK regulator has shared data on the Covishield jab with its European counterpart, No 10 says.

item.title: Prosecutors drop Troubles cases against ex-soldiers
item.description: Two Army veterans had faced murder charges over deaths in Londonderry in 1972, including on Bloody Sunday.

item.title: Man charged with common assault after Chris Whitty incident
item.description: A group of men were seen accosting England's chief medical officer in a park on Sunday.

item.title: Boeing 737 cargo jet crashes into sea off Honolulu, Hawaii
item.description: The US Coast Guard reportedly rescues the two pilots of the plane, which crashed near Honolulu.

item.title: Love Island: ITV condemns death threats sent to contestant Chloe Burrows
item.description: Messages sent to contestant Chloe Burrows online were "wholly unacceptable", the broadcaster says.

item.title: Queen Victoria and Elizabeth II's statues toppled
item.description: Monuments are torn down in Manitoba at a protest over the deaths of indigenous Canadian children.

item.title: Murder probe after Oxford Circus stab victim dies
item.description: Officers want to speak to two young skateboarders who helped detain a suspect at the scene.

item.title: Covid: Infections rising, but vaccines saving lives
item.description: Hospital admissions are not rising at the same rate as infections across the UK, health officials say.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: US sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson set to miss Olympic Games after positive cannabis test
item.description: US sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson receives a one-month ban after testing positive for marijuana - and is set to miss the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: BBC Bitesize edits page to remove list of climate change 'benefits'
item.description: The education site had listed "healthier outdoor lifestyles" as one plus of warmer temperatures.

item.title: Kim Leadbeater: Sister of Jo Cox is new Batley and Spen MP
item.description: Kim Leadbeater says a key part of her by-election success was being "born and bred" in the area.

item.title: Microsoft’s Windows 11 blue screen of death to become black
item.description: The new colour in the Windows 11 operating system matches the new black logon and shutdown screens.

item.title: Strolling crocodile sparks panic in India village
item.description: Wildlife officials caught the animal and released it into a nearby river.

item.title: Vaccine hesitancy: Your job or the jab?
item.description: Health workers once on the frontline of the pandemic are now embroiled in a row over vaccine mandates.

item.title: Soul Cap: Afro swim cap Olympic rejection 'heartbreaking' for black swimmers
item.description: The governing body says Soul Caps are unsuitable as they don't follow "the natural form of the head".

item.title: Lebanon’s ‘suffocating’ energy crisis
item.description: Six-year-old Sedra is one of the people whose lives have been put at risk by the country's energy crisis.

item.title: Pride Month: Labour MP Dan Carden on alcohol addiction
item.description: An MP gives an emotional speech on his family's support as he battled his alcohol addiction.

item.title: Personal Independence Payments: 'Have I less than six months to live?'
item.description: The government is accused of creating a 'two tier welfare system' for people who have terminal illnesses by two charities.

item.title: Euro 2020: The fans who will be at the England v Ukraine match
item.description: England fans with tickets for Saturday's quarter-final tell us how they've managed to get there.

item.title: Parents of children called Alexa challenge Amazon
item.description: Youngsters are being bullied over their name - also the default wake word for the tech firm's smart speakers.

item.title: Batley and Spen: How Labour held on - and what it means for Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: Holding Batley and Spen will feel like a by-election gain for Labour - so how did they do it?

item.title: Batley and Spen: Fraught by-election concludes in dramatic fashion
item.description: How drama built as Labour retained its Batley and Spen seat by a narrow margin.

item.title: Turkey's plastics ban: Where does the UK send its waste now?
item.description: Turkey is due to ban most plastic waste sent from the UK, so tonnes of packaging will need a new home.

item.title: A Cambodian village ripped apart by a bad batch of rice wine
item.description: At least 30 Cambodians died recently in less than a month after drinking toxic home-brewed alcohol.

item.title: Bobby Gillespie and Jehnny Beth: 'Brexit has destroyed any hope for young musicians'
item.description: Bobby Gillespie and Jehnny Beth on culture wars, and why Utopian Ashes is not a break-up record.

item.title: Hampstead Heath: How the 'lungs of the metropolis' remained unblackened
item.description: If a Victorian-era landowner hadn't been thwarted, Hampstead Heath as we know it might not exist.

item.title: How airlines will stop you losing your bags in the future
item.description: In 2019, 25.4 million bags went missing, costing the industry billions of dollars - can big data solve the problem?

item.title: Austrian Grand Prix: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton fastest in second practice
item.description: Lewis Hamilton sets the pace in second practice at the Austrian Grand Prix to give Mercedes hope of clawing back some lost ground to Red Bull.

item.title: Jones expects 'Trump-like confidence' from USA, with fly-half Smith set for England debut
item.description: Harlequins fly-half Marcus Smith makes his eagerly awaited England debut, with Gloucester's Lewis Ludlow captain against the United States on Sunday.

item.title: Murray & Soares reach doubles second round at Wimbledon
item.description: Britain's Jamie Murray and Brazilian partner Bruno Soares are into the second round of the men's doubles at Wimbledon.

item.title: Euros archive: Life before goalline technology - England v Ukraine in 2012
item.description: Relive the last time England faced Ukraine at the European Championship in 2012.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Karolina Pliskova beats Tereza Martincova in third round - best shots
item.description: Watch the best shot as the Czech Republic's Karolina Pliskova beats her compatriot Tereza Martincova 6-3 6-3 to secure a place in fourth round at Wimbledon.

item.title: AstraZeneca: Could you have had a jab from the Covishield batch?
item.description: If you received an Indian-made version of the AstraZeneca vaccine, could it affect your ability to go abroad?

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,00 fans next week, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: What are the social distancing rules and when could they end?
item.description: It's not clear whether we will still have to wear masks and socially distance once lockdown eases.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as almost 45 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: How many cases are in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?
